page.title: 02Farndon Fields Farm
page.content: The farm is situated on the Farndon Road within a mile of Harborough centre.It covers{177 acres,}all of which are under crops.Nearby farms are split between crops,mostly,{wheat}and {barley,}and{pasture.}The owners,the Pilkington family,bought the farm in 1950 and 3 of the family work on it with 1 full time helper and 3 members of the Youth Training Scheme at harvest time.The main crop is{winter {wheat}(112 acres) with 39 acres of{oil {seed rape.}The remaining acreage is taken up with{winter barley,potatoes, {strawberries,sweetcorn,}and over 4 acres of other{vegetables}in{rotation. Vegetables are sold at the farm but the grain is sold to grain merchants in Leicester.To increase farm sales they plan to convert their garage into a farm shop.However,they have no plans to increase the farm acreage.
